talk.author: did:plc:qc34cqjefez4xzfchmwiuqmp
talk.utter: When my cat Sheba (she who must be obeyed) dares to go out on our deck, "my" crows mob her and scream at her, the same angry vocalizations they use when "escorting" coops or kestrels out of the neighborhood.   They call in back up too. It's quite a sight.

talk.author: did:plc:dxeb6bgiezfj5wsjdmag73bj
talk.utter: Similar situation with a mockingbird two years ago and my garden cat, Chester. This bird divebombed poor Chester with a limp, and I honestly wonder if they confused his brother who is a bit more adventurous. He also sounded like a car alarm, amongst seagull and killdeer calls.

talk.author: did:plc:qc34cqjefez4xzfchmwiuqmp
talk.utter: Mockers will divebomb people when they are nesting.  Poor Chester.
